intro: Vaughania mahafalensis, commonly known as the Mahafaly hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Vaughania mahafalensis is adapted to the tropical climate of Madagascar and is often found in moist, shaded areas.
